channel.title: Rsc rts
channel.description:
I found this community back in 2007-08 through a rsc private server and the development side of things is what I was interested in (especially since there were some source releases, freescape was my first dl followed by franks server). I began to learn xml, I wanted to create custom maps etc etc and eventually it got me into objectactions etc etc and I have progressed. I may have not learned the proper way, but I learned to the best of my ability. I feel confident and I have already begun the basics for the RSC RTS.
This community is full of trolls, there was once a time (hard to believe) when people were respected and actually helpful. I remember all the bs questions I asked, people took the time to explain and I am thankful for that. I don't see the point in doing something for this community but I guess deep down there is just that tiny fade of hope. Hope that this community will get out of the shitter, mature and actually respect one another. I came into this community when it was a friendly environment so I would like to leave the same way. Everyone who is anyone has contributed to this community, it could be a tiny code snippet, helpful advice, feedback, whatever.. everyone has left their impression. Before I leave this community I would like to contribute with something different, something unique.
I plan on doing as much as I can to moparclassic before summer begins (right now I am so caught up in studies at coolege) but I want to do a "final" project during the summer. The final project being a RSC RTS. What are your guys thoughts on a RSC RTS (Real Time Strategy) game. Age of Empires, Starcraft, Warcraft etc etc are all RTS games.
The first game I played on PC was Warcraft II and my first online rpg game was RSC. So the game will go back to my beginning. I am still planning how it the game play will be, but I got some great ideas. Don't get over your head, it will be pretty basic nothing crazy like Starcraft II.
Thoughts or Concerns?
The basic map and well.. only map will be the rsc landscape replicated (but much smaller). Each section of land will have a unique bonus. Below is just an example.
Wilderness = able to create demons (powerful) Draynor = great supply of resources

This does seem like a great idea and project, you most certainly have my support, help, and full attention. I’ve been reading this topic for about an hour, going through graphics, and looking at models XD. This is what I love about the RSPS community- it draws people together, and together they can do great things.

Question- Have you started yet? I personally would start with some sort of tile based system, I think that might have been mentioned already.

item.title: Rsc rts
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

DealingRocks:

It would be cool if you got it working and people were able to make their own (eventually larger) maps.

A map editor is will be easy to create and I plan to have different maps. Maps can range from 32x32 to 256x256. Map triggers and such will not be covered.

Still looking on feedback on game play, if anyone wants to contribute…

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:19, topic:439152”]Fence and Stone Wall - Blocks opponents from attacking, players can however destroy the fence or wall.
Houses - Used to build more units.
Farms/Fishing spots - Workers use this to gather “food”.
Mine/Ore - Used to gather resources for upgrades.
Blacksmith - upgrades for better soldiers (bronze, iron, steel etc)
Castle - Creates better units
Barracks? - Create units?
Mage Arena - Create mages…[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Rsc rts
item.dc:creator: @DealingRocks DealingRocks
item.description:
@DealingRocks wrote:

This sounds like a fun idea. I have recently just started playing Starcraft: Brood Wars after a few year hiatus. It will be weird playing such a rigidly tile based RTS but like you said, just basic and fun. It would be cool if you got it working and people were able to make their own (eventually larger) maps.

I could see the games lasting 5-10 minutes each with maps so small XD could be fast-paced

Read full topic

item.title: Rsc rts
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

Vortex, buildings are simple images on older RTS games…

As you can see…
http://www.spriters-resource.com/pc_computer/warcraft2/humanbuildingssummer.png
An image for “building” and an image after completion.

The issue is… in the scenario of RSC being an RTS game, what would players build?

Ideas :

Fence and Stone Wall - Blocks opponents from attacking, players can however destroy the fence or wall.
Houses - Used to build more units.
Farms/Fishing spots - Workers use this to gather “food”.
Mine/Ore - Used to gather resources for upgrades.
Blacksmith - upgrades for better soldiers (bronze, iron, steel etc)
Castle - Creates better units
Barracks? - Create units?
Mage Arena - Create mages…

The game will be very basic, maps will be restricted to 32x32 area… considering 1 character uses 1 sq and a building can use up to 4-6 squares.

Once again, do not expect this to be starcraft II or some elite game, but very minimal and very basic, but fun and worth the time.

Read full topic

item.title: Rsc rts
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

It’s going to be 2D (like your looking down at a chess board). I think the best way to accomplish it is to manipulate a client so you can view your character on a private server from the top view with a slant.

I am still figuring out the sprite part. I want to be able to easily recognize which each unit is. (Mages will be given god staff, wizard robes + hat)

Warcraft II below… you can see the mages as an example…

Another issue arises which is buildings, should players be able to build or is the map (rsc map) already in play… players can just choose to put their starting guy in a building… and take control of it? I like the concept of building an empire…

Read full topic
